title: ok company
pros:
Employee stock ownership plan that contributes Publix stock to associates each year at no cost to them
An opportunity to purchase additional shares of our privately held stock
Annual holiday cash bonus
All hourly associates are paid weekly
401(k) retirement savings plan with a company match
Group health plan (with prescription benefits)
Group dental plan
Group vision plan
Free flu shots
Direct deposit in up to three separate checking or savings accounts
Credit union membership
Tuition reimbursement
Service awards
Employee assistance program
Opportunities for advancement
Opportunity to participate annually in a survey to let management know your opinion on a wide range of workplace quality issues
cons: If you don't work 1500 hours a year you get no benefits you have to be vested 3 years at over 1000 hours per year in order to get free stocks to do good luck to you

title: Publix prides itself on its provision of premier customer service, and that is the only avenue where they excel.
pros: A clean and tidy storefront, usually friendly staff.
cons: Poor communication and decision making from management, priorities seem to change with the season, employee well being no amongst them.

title: Amazing company, no regrets
pros: Very caring for their employees. The benefits is what is very amazing for the company. The ability to purchase stock, setting up 401ks, and the unique atmosphere to be around. Love interacting with people.
cons: For customer service, understaffed almost all the time, so cashiers barely get help from baggers or staff help. Pay does not match the quality effort that we perform at the company.

title: An Average Part Time Job
pros: I started young and was able to successfully advance with hard work and dedication. I was able to increase my income over three years and gain the respect of local management. Your team can be a great way to help with success.
cons: An average or below average part time job. Hours are almost nowhere near consistent for part time individuals, the pay is not significant unless you work hard and receive positive evaluations. Time for advancement can be slow and your team and managers can be hit or miss. Working in CS and engaging with old, white, privileged customers can get annoying quickly. You have to be able to smile through it all and ALWAYS provide premier quality customer service.

title: It's like a war behind the scenes
pros:
I don't have any pros. I would say the benefits, but you need to work at Publix for 1 year in order to get Health benefits. About 4 - 6 months for Dental benefits.

Publix is great for short term, it's only good for long-term if you have nothing in your life to do and never went to college.
cons:
Management is half and half. At least at my store they give great hours but for how much work I do, I only get paid $10.50. 

I also was told I was getting promoted to get paid more, but that hasn't reflected in my Publix org profile for 3 weeks now. I've been working at Publix since COVID started and haven't gotten one evaluation yet either to get promoted even further.

If you have employees not pushing their own weight, they won't let them go. Especially in a smaller store, they need all the help they can get.

Publix takes pride in "Intolerant of waste" although each night tons of waste gets trashed. People who didn't buy the extra chicken they made or the hundreds of donuts. Publix should be donating this food to food banks each night instead of tossing it. That's if they really have these core values in place.

1 of our full time front end employees hasn't been to work for like 5 months and they don't want to let her go and give her benefits to someone else. Speaking of full time, an employee in the Deli who worked at Publix for only 3 months got full time even though he's horrible at his job. Nice management.

2 people in my store got COVID-19, but no management staff wanted to inform us who had it. We also found out about this issue through our employee Portal, they don't even tell us in person. CEO of Publix doesn't care about your safety.

title: A Nightmare to work for
pros: Barely able to afford rent
cons: Incompitent, bigoted, overworked, understaffed, underpaid

title: Publix is an amazing company to work for
pros: honestly the best job i've had in 13 years. From 15 years old starting to dig ditches for my dad's irrigation company too about 21 years old i tried a few different jobs, and finally settled on a career of meat cutting. since then I've worked for 4 retailers and Publix is above and beyond the best to work for. I am hoping to soon advance into department management, and I honestly feel like I can make a career in this company through hard work and dedication.
cons: can't think of any right now.

title: Awesome place to work
pros: There is nothing “hard” about this job, of course it is work and there will be challenges but nothing is super hard. I am always greeted by my coworkers and even those in other departments make sure they smile and speak. Everyone makes me feel comfortable and it’s definitely a family vibe! The benefits offered are amazing even part time workers are offered health insurance.
cons: You pretty much HAVE to have open availability in order to be a full timer. You also have to come in pretty much anytime they need you to and if you can’t, you lessen your chances of being a full timer (even if it’s your day off). I’m not sure if this flexibility con is dependent on the store location or if it’s all Publix stores.

title: Great First Job
pros: The people are generally nice and they are really flexible with scheduling. If you're in high school or just looking for something on the side for a little extra money I know a ton of people who use Publix as a secondary stream of income and a getaway from their primary work.
cons: If you don't know how to have confrontations with people, mostly customers, this may not be the role for you. Sometimes people will say things that may rub you the wrong way, but it is definitely in the best interests of everybody involved that you learn how to shake off or defuse those situations to mitigate negativity in the work place.

title: Publix Customer Service Dept
pros: If you get full-time, they give you free stock as part of the profit sharing plan. You also get a small bonus around the holiday (if you're full-time).
cons: If you punch in exactly 3 MINUTES late it's considered a tardy. Get more than 3 of those per 6-month period and you won't get a raise. The hours are crazy. Bosses micromanage and push you hard.

title: Good to Employees
pros:
Benefits: awesome vision/dental insurance for almost nothing. 
Set your own schedule (within reason) part time
cons: Some people get promoted to management who have absolutely no business managing toilet paper, they’re terrible at it, that can be I credibly frustrating. Otherwise, it’s a pleasure.

title: Only a good company to work for if you’re judging it from a grocery/retail perspective
pros: Benefits for full time associates. Also, partial tuition reimbursement for current college students.
cons: No consistent structure. Expectations change almost weekly and come with threats of counseling statements that never actually get enforced. Micro managing from all levels of management. Sometimes unrealistic expectations and deadlines. Morale is not a priority to management, all they care about it productivity.

title: Cashier publix
pros: They give good benefits during COVID
cons: Management sucks..They catch a attitude with you just for asking a question and speak to you with no respect and expect for you to put up with it.

title: Good workplace, but the company couldn't care less about you
pros: The company is relatively professional in its interactions with you, it's pretty consistent with its hours, and as long as you do what you're told you will not have any issues
cons:
You're constantly promised opportunities to advance that barely exist, you're promised raises that will be far less than what you deserve, and you will always feel like you're just treading water. It becomes very clear after a few months that the management plays favorites and if you're not one of the favorites, you will get the minimum raise amount if any, you will never be promoted, and you have zero incentive to do anything besides the bare minimum amount of work required to keep your job there. They do not care about your ideas to improve work flow or the work environment and there is absolutely no wiggle room in how things may be done. They are looking strictly for people to blindly follow orders and will suck the soul out of you. They also pay significantly less than ALL of the competition. It's a bland corporate environment that only benefits the people who are willing to play along and pretend like the company isn't just a money-grabbing, racist corporation.

Side note: When the pandemic hit, every single company besides Publix gave out hazard pay or some sort of bonus compensation. We got a $50 gift card at the beginning of the pandemic and the first time someone at your store got COVID, you got another gift card as some sort of hush money. Disgusting. The gift cards were taxed by the way, and the taxes were taken out of your pay check.

title: Good job shady management
pros:
Weekly pay
Weekly coupons and benefits
Clean and efficient work environment 
Friendly co-workers
Days go by quickly
cons:
Management does not incentivize hard workers. They exploit those who put in more effort. 
They will keep you where they want you even if others around you are moving up
They will not want to promote you if you do the lower jobs too well. 
They do not appropriately address associate complaints. 
Managers are overworked and miserable and take it out on subordinates

title: This department is a scam...
pros:
good subs
Good sliced meat
fried chicken is ok some days
nice people sometimes
free stuff sometimes
cons:
no team work
no room for growth
learn by yourself or hope someone helps you 
unreliable evaluations

title: Great Company depends on management.
pros: Flexible hours, Holiday bonus, Free Stock after 1 years of work with 1,000 hours before your hired date. Discount program for travel, electronics theme parks ect.. 401k
cons: Customers, can be pretty rude, management can be bad, could have coworkers who are slackers, baggers, cashiers have to get shopping carts in all year around weather conditions, stores with a big lot can have carts all over and far out.

title: Awesome Flexibility with scheduling
pros: I worked 1 day a week for no more than 4 hours. Appreciate them for letting me do that. Wish I continued to take advantage of that but paychecks were extremely low of course
cons: Can’t take tips when you take people’s groceries out. Another employee ruined that. But not many cons to be honest.

title: Great pay, plenty of hours, mixed management and zero empathy
pros: Great Pay. Plenty of hours. Career growth.
cons: Career growth comes with bending over and giving your life to them. They’ll take everything out of you for the decent pay. They want the whole 5am 16 pallet truck stocked, back room clean, birds worked and end caps full before 7am.

title: It’s an OK job, not ideal for long term
pros:
Starting pay is around $3-4 higher than state minimum wage.
Opportunities to advance to higher positions within department.
cons:
Requests to transfer departments don’t often get approved, which can cause a roadblock for those wishing to branch out and expand upon their work experience.
Working here isn’t worth it in the long run unless you’re able to become full time or work your way up to management positions.
I was witness to unprofessional behavior from coworkers and management toward myself and other associates.

title: A Moderate Place to Work
pros: I've been working part time for about 8 months now. The pay is good enough for a part time job. While I haven't actually gone for tuition reimbursement, from what I understand it is very doable and can be rather nice.
cons: While the managers and team leaders may be nice, that all changes after you've been with the store long enough. You start to notice that all they seem to do is talk on their phones and to each other, while at the same time getting mad when you talk to your fellow co-workers for a grand total of 5 minutes while you still get more work done than they've done all week. Schedule requesting can be a bit tough if its more of a last minute deal. I also work the closing shift which means that I am there from 2:00-11:00, which means I pretty much go to bed shortly after I get home. So with that in mind, I had some personal activities that took place on Mondays and Wednesdays and started around 7:30, so I asked my manager if I could have my schedule shifted to allow me to attend such events (since I work on truck days aka Sunday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Friday and usually have Mondays off). So the following 2 weeks nothing happened simply because I had some time off requests and they were working around them, but the third week, I get scheduled for Monday and Wednesday for the closing shift, its like stuff like that just doesn't click with them, or maybe I got on someone's bad side because the Publix way is favoring certain employees over others. For instance, the person at my store who is responsible for changing the sale tags on Tuesdays found out one day that they didn't get a promotion, so instead of sucking it up, they left within 20 minutes of being there and left the rest of use to do their job, and as far as I know, nothing has been done to punish them, they still get every single weekend off as a full time associate and seem to get away with doing barely any work within a reasonable amount of time.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Publix cares greatly about their employees which ultimately maintains the positive environment.
cons: Sometimes it will feel very understaffed due to regional management trying to cut hours. This unfortunately puts a high amount of stress on the associates as well as tiresome work.

title: Work Life Balance is Awful
pros: Benefits, Potential for bonuses in management, flexible hours
cons: Management, Benefits are slowly being taken away, if youre full time you have no time of your own

title: Just Okay so Far
pros: Nice co-workers who want to help but they are all stressed and low morale.
cons:
Low end pay for type of work - cake decorators start at about $12 per hour and that's way below industry standard.
Unorganized - Complete mess of organization in the decorating department
Understaffed - there is no possible way for the team to get the production list sent down by corporate done every day, so morale is low. New hires like me feel like they are doing something wrong

title: Great co-workers, supportive culture, and happy customers
pros:
-Proud to work at Publix because everyone has a common sense of mission to provide ultimate customer satisfaction

-High quality products, both Publix brand and from 3rd party suppliers/producers

-The whole company is employee-owned, which adds to the unique sense of mission
cons:
-Often searching for busy work when business becomes slow, can be tedious

-Pay could be better, raise every 6 months depending on employee performance

-My part time shifts usually have no consistent start time, end time, and length. Can get 35 hours one week, and 20 the next, depending on business.

title: Best job
pros: Pay people you work with
cons: Hard work on your body

title: Same pros and cons depending on what you’re looking for
pros: Fast paced, detail oriented, constantly on your feet, lots of customer interaction, very labor intensive.
cons: Can be the same as the pros, depending on who you are. If you’re looking to move up in retail it will take many years. Most assistant department managers have been there 10+ years and the only way around this is to have a heavily lopsided work/life balance in favor of work.

title: Its a okay place to work for a first job right out of high school or make a career out of.
pros: Co-workers/some management, fun place to work at times. It is and will ever be one of the best places to retire from because of the stock option and the 401k option is awesome.
cons: Management, extremely hard to get fired from, don't expect managers to do stuff for you when they say they will a very few will do what you ask especially if you need help, a lot has changed within the 5 years I have worked there ever sense we got a new CEO the company has gone down hill. a lot of the managers you run into are just straight up I'm better than you attitude on top of all if you go to HR about a manager they don't do anything to help the situation and the store manager will always choose the managers side you are always in the wrong. On top of all that being said it is extremely hard to get fulltime I was one of the best workers at my Publix but I was never praised for doing a good job I was always the one clearing the lot or picking up after everyone.

title: Please Read **
pros:
Benefits 
Wish I was posting about the amazing first 4 years with Publix I had in many different stores with every type of leadership and several promotions. Instead, I'm posting about the worst 1 year 6 months I have ever experienced in a department
cons:
- It's a who you know not what you do type environment... 
- First month in this department the ENTIRE team quit except for myself and two others. 6 in total. Should have been a here is your sign moment...
- They will ask you to resubmit your request after you have already been waiting months and received an initial confirmation. 
- Pay was a constant issue working 3rd shift. I was placed on two-week vacation when I started in this department so I did not lose my vacation time. I had two weeks left and did not want to take it being so new to the team. I was willing to sacrifice this for the new position. I WAS NOT PAID and the SOLUTION was to work 80 HOURS OT OVER THE NEXT MONTH TO GET MY MONEY THAT I WAS ALREADY OWED. SO I WORKED 6-7 DAYS A WEEK TO GET MY PAY FOR THE NEXT MONTH.
- If you took a Friday off working third shift you would be short for the previous and current week. REGARDLESS if you STILL WORKED 5 DAYS THAT WEEK. Solution - Work an extra hour each day next week to make sure you are correctly PAID for that week. No this was not OT.
- Several requests were just lost. We were so short-staffed all the time I could understand "losing" request as well I guess. 
- I was clear about the third shift when I was interviewed and placed a REQUEST for 2nd shift. While off work for my scheduled weekend a new hire was given second shift and we were told that's not a decision based on seniority " Almost everything is when it's convenient in this department including parking " Then why make a deal about request and seniority too begin with?
- Your "ideas" and "suggestions" that better the team and department will be stolen and no proper credit will be given. They will "forget" you submitted it. I kept folders *
- If your close friends with leadership then your life will be grand. 
- If you do not brown-nose keep that resume handy!
- Management is a do what we say not what we do type team.
- They like to enact policies then only enforce them when its convenient or beneficial to them or their "favorites"

My termination was even dirtier then above mentioned things. Ive waited 3 months to post this to see if I was still mad. Sadly I am but I've got great things going personally! This has just been a bump in the road... but one I needed to address.

title: Very dissatisfied
pros: The pay is great the company itself is great. Aka Lakeland Florida locations are run amazingly great managers and great employees
cons: My experience has been  Sexual-harassment was not taken seriously thereI have had my breast Ive had guys talk about sex in front of me.  Use vulgar language . when I reported it to managers nothing was done. It really sucked and hurt that I would report misconduct and my managers did nothing to stop it. I was told I complain to much.  I was not even allowed to make a formal complaint with HR. My managers swept it under the rug like it was no big deal. My Management held family medical leave against me. They punished me for having serious medical condition. It’s more the leader ship ( managers) that brings the company down at the Buford location

title: Great for a secondary or first job, terrible as a career.
pros:
Easy work
Minors can work here
Flexibility (this is the only REAL reason you should work here)
Half-year raises
Good 401k
cons:
Promotions are super slow 
Pay is below the competitive level
Work is boring, will likely make you feel like a shell
Scheduling is crazy: They will make you close at 12 A.M and expect you back at 6:30 in the morning if your availability is open.
Entitled customers.

title: Fantastic company, difficult to balance hours w. Life
pros: Loved my team, we were like family. I enjoyed coming into work every day! I didn't mind staying late or coming in early.
cons: The work life balance was difficult with the hours I was scheduled. Open to close back to back was a regular thing. Also, pay was too low for the amount of work expected.

title: It May Not Be For Everybody
pros:
-It's a good first job to get entry-level experience 
-Benefits
-Nice customers that make your day or give feedback
-Nice coworkers
cons: It may not be for everybody. Good customer service is important and that includes being able to handle even the rudest customers. You have to remember you're at work and smile because if you're in a bad mood or are not having a good day/days, customers may see that on your face and may complain to your manager. Too many customer complaints are not good. So you got to work on what you've got going on during those bad mood days.

title: Good place for a first job
pros:
Relatively easy to get a job
Decent work culture (people tend to care at least somewhat about their job)
Reasonable pay
cons:
Your experience could be very different depending on management at that store/district
It's not amazing, but you shouldn't expect it to be. It's an entry-level, retail job.

title: Overall, a positive experience
pros:
-Hires young
-Great benefits
-Flexible depending on position
-Decent pay
-Positive atmosphere
cons: -At times you feel like an actor/robot when trying to stick to providing "exceptional customer service". If you don't meet their standards, which are pretty high, they let you know.

title: Work at Publix
pros: There is opportunity for you to grow in the business. It can take you to the next level in management.
cons: I feel as though at times, there lack a sense of communication and compassion. Over the years it seems to be a different style of management,

title: A bad store manager can change your career path.
pros: They are building new stores every week.
cons:
The benefits kind of suck. 
Once in management your home life balance goes out the window,

title: Good place to work as a student
pros: they work with your schedule and if you stay with them and are eager to work your way up you can learn a lot
cons: There's a lot of annoying people you have to work with and the performance reviews very often do not reflect your work at all

title: Great place to work
pros: The best thing for me would be the flexibility of the schedule. As a college student, I let my department manager know when I was able to work and he worked me then.
cons: From what I have seen, Publix doesn’t promote in store past team lead. If you are going to move past team lead, you will probably be transferred to another store.

title: The pub life
pros:
Pay is not bad
Managers move rapidly
Company stock 
Solid benefits
Opportunity to move up
Competitive pay 
The ability to make a lifelong career if dedicated enough
cons:
Managers move rapidly 
Must play the Publix game to get promoted (you need to be what Publix incisions there employees to be)
Very store and environment dependent
Coworkers make all the difference because each department is very team based

title: They say what they do, and do what they say
pros: It is a great working environment. But understand, Publix has high standards and expects exceptional work from their associates. And always understand you will only get out what you are willing to put in while working here. If you do an exceptional job, they will bend over backwards to work with you. Also understand that no company is perfect, Publix included, but they take care of their associates with great benefits and great working environment.
cons: You are on your feet for long periods of time. But you understand this when you accept the position.

title: Micromanagement
pros: Good benefits and it looks good on a resume for customer service
cons: Company as a whole is all about micromanaging absolutely everything. Not a very friendly environment. The store I worked at discriminated against my hair color because I’m a natural red head but they believed it was dyed which was not allowed.

title: Good benefits but you will feel trapped
pros: The pays good, better then any other warehouse. The benefits are also actually pretty good too.
cons: Don't follow the hype though, their stocks are okay. Not really anything special nor are the dividends that good better off going publix stocks. And if a hurricane hits or screams people 12-14 hour shifts are going to happen. You think you want hours still you have so much you miss out on eating and seeing family just to sleep.

title: Fun place to work
pros: Fun place to work if you like physical work, more than minimum wage, good place to work if you like lifting weights (cause you're always lifting heavy things), great place to be a manager
cons: takes a long, long time to become a publix manager usually, physical work is tiring, minimum wage isn't $15 in Florida, pay is kind of low, if you're not a nice person I don't recommend working here because you have to be very nice to customers

title: Good stepping stone, not something to do for the long-run, especially if you have other career goals.
pros: good people, good opportunities, stock options, benefits.
cons: micro-managing, lack of trust, lack of value, dictatorial culture.

title: Can be good or bad depending on management
pros: (Part time) Can work whenever you want, take as much time off you want
cons:
Full time associates often working late nights, early mornings
Typical retail complaints
Managers get shifted around often, don't get comfortable with a good manager because they could be gone within a week
Promotions get handed to the wrong people constantly

title: Great place sometimes good co workers
pros: They have great benefits for you and the place I worked first were amazing. Felt like a family.
cons: When I got to the new store the people were not very nice and luckily I got a job soon after but a lot of my former coworkers were unhappy and getting written up.

title: Great Company
pros: Company cares about its people, coworkers and management were great, benefits were excellent, tons of room to grow
cons: 2nd and 3rd shift were not great but knew that going into it, location (lakeland) is not ideal

title: Treated like am a 12 year old
pros: Job is easy not much to it
cons: Treated like am 12 years old by managers want to go to the bathroom ask permission or get paged to come to the front within 3 minutes. Will keep you after the scheduled time to get off you are not respected nor is your time or personal life.

title: Best company I've ever worked for.
pros: If you work hard, they definitely reward you. Also benefits for part time positions.
cons: If you are unlucky enough to get stuck with a crap manager. My assistant manager is my only complaint, I've had worse though.

title: Great Company
pros:
Employees are treated well
Pay is good for the jobs in the stores
Good benefits even for part time employees is offerred after some hours worked with company
Stock given as soon as you are hired
Perks/rewards for commendations and hard work
Range of hours
Upward movement good for younger employees
Understanding regarding family emergencies and "life" issues that sometimes happen
cons:
85% of employees are part time
Not much upward movement for older employees hired

title: Great part time job
pros: Great work environment, usually adequate staffing and proper resources given to perform successfully and not under stress, collect free stock, management is well trained and treat employees well (at certain locations anyway), employees receive recognition and get raises every 6 months
cons: Not a living wage to start, schedules can be really good or really bad depending on manager

title: Poor managment not fun place to work always the same
pros: Pay is good as a starter only but when you realize the task you are given its not worth it plus if you are overnight u will lose ur sleep scedule
cons: Poor managment not fun at all

title: Happy to be out!
pros: Coworkers, pay isn't enough but better than minimum wage. Hours, if management likes you.
cons: Management is hit or miss. Always understaffed. Hard to make your voice heard.

title: Fine company
pros: All my coworkers were friendly, cool people. Honestly a fun job experience overall.
cons: It all depends on who the manager is. My manager was very much into micromanaging so I took a job elsewhere but that's my only complaint.

title: Good opportunity if you can manage the grund
pros: Good Benefits, flexible hours, bi-yearly raise opportunities
cons: Rude customers, management inconsistencies, stressful and demanding at times

title: Great community, terrible company
pros: Great coworkers, clean work space
cons: Do not mandate mask for customers, no reminders for customers to wear face mask, not enough employees

title: Publix is the Place to be!
pros: It's a great company that really cares about its associates and offers opportunities to move up in the company!
cons: Because they allow you to work at such a young age and they really don't age discriminate at all with there being much older staff there as well. It can create a bit of a gossip pool with so many generations not really seeing eye to eye.

title: Great company, terrible management
pros: Benefits, good pay, reasonable hours
cons: Dramatic Co workers, managers showing favoritism. Managers do not care about anyone but themselves

title: The Truth
pros: Flexible schedule and benefits for workers
cons: Too dependent on certain workers due to them hiring people who are not capable of doing the job right. They also underpay the people who hold the company down, and take advantage of them with little appreciation.

title: Great for people looking to build a career
pros:
Pay is great
Wonderful coworkers
Amazing place to work!
cons:
Your hours will be all over the place, if you’re part time.
Fast work environment.
Getting trained is more like shadowing someone for a couple days then being let loose.

title: My Opinion
pros: It's a great place to work coworkers are nice and the manager is nice as well. It's a great starting job although as far as career choices go it'd be better to start when your young if you want to make a career out of it.
cons: There's nothing wrong with working at Publix, it's a great place to be. It's just not my cup of tea.

title: Cashier's Review
pros: Employees here seem to truly enjoy their jobs. It's not perfect, but it is definitely pleasurable. Plus, the benefits are also great if one decides to make a career here.
cons: Can be fast-paced depending on location and dealing with customers can be a hassle.

title: Grocery Clerk
pros: Can be rewarding. Pay is okay for the job, and there is opportunity to move up.
cons: Be prepared to work. It can be physically demanding and you have to put in your time to be considered for promotion unless you shine right from the start

title: Good part time job
pros: Good team and management. Get you up to speed on everything you need to know. They have good resources and funding. Can work with your schedule if you are working more than one job.
cons: Unexpectedly high amount of unpleasant customers. There are many scenarios where you end up with nothing to do. While you should try to find things to do, management can be a bit unreasonable in this area.

title: Great Company to Work For
pros: Good Benefits, Fun Place to Work, Make Good Friends, Job Security, Advancement if you work hard for it
cons: Overwhelming, Busy, Not always enough help,

title: publix
pros: Decent pay, and a flexible schedule
cons: they will schedule you back to back open and closing shifts depending on the management. Very poor handling of Covid

title: A career option, if you want to make it a career.
pros: Plenty of positions in multiple facets of the company, however don't expect to be positioned where you want, expect to be positioned where you're needed.
cons: Advancement is based either on personal connections or opening windows attached to relocation. Little to no chance of being fast-tracked in a local community.

title: Used To Be The Best
pros: 401K, Benefits Package, Coworkers are among the best people to work with, Managers
cons: Store Managers, District Managers, Anyone on the higher corporate food chain

title: This was both a very lively and social job, which offered good experience and descent starting pay.
pros: The customers and coworkers, for the most part, were awesome to work with. I learned a lot about the work place and responsibility, as this was my first job. My hours were great and they were very flexible with when I was able to work.
cons: Some of the management did not seem like they wanted to be there. Customers, mainly older, who are loyal, longtime members are usually very cranky.

title: Great company to work for
pros: It is an employee owned company, meaning associate purchase stock to help it grow. The 401K is nice and they offer a variety of opportunities at corporate and national level.
cons: Climbing the corporate ladder can be hard for new associates

title: Meh
pros:
Good company looking from the outside in
Good food and service
cons:
Really hard to advance (atleast in the Deli). You are basically competing against a small army of part-timers for the coveted full-time position, and you have to be full-time before you will even be considered for management. 
Starting pay is decent for a retail grocery store but it doesn't increase more than a few dollars in total (which takes years) and isn't enough to keep up with inflation. They just raised the minimum recently ($12.00 per hour for Deli Clerk) but didn't add my previous raises on top of it, so I'm making almost the same as brand new people.

title: Overall good
pros: Starting pay is decent, when you are self-sufficient the management doesn't stand over your shoulder
cons: Raising expectations of work to be completed and cutting hours simultaneously, training program is basically nonexistant(which happens to work for me), and failure to give the full-time position and pay that goes along with being over a sub department

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Great opportunities for advancement, and great benefits. Competitive.
cons: There is a certain lack of professionalism and interpersonal communication skills amongst those in management positions. I believe its just something that wasn't taught until very recently, and is still something that needs to be worked on.

title: Fairness
pros: They offer insurance benefits health, dental and eye exams.
cons: If you work part time please be healthy because if you are ever sick and out of work you have no financial backing like full time workers. There is no disability insurance no vacation time to use! And holiday pay before and after will dwindle think 100.00 pay check with like 17 hours a week!

title: Great job for young adults!
pros: This company has amazing benefits, even if you are still a young adult and don't have much job experience! The pay is reasonable and Publix is very strict on overworking minors.
cons: The customers can be a lot to handle, but it is worth it!

title: Great Workplace!
pros: There are a lot of benefits from working at publix and it is also a family friendly work environment. You also get paid weekly and you get very decent hours a week.
cons: Sometimes the store can get very busy at times and it gets hard to manage.

title: Secure Investment Company
pros: Long term benefits for retirement are great if you can buy a lot of shares through them.
cons: Typical retail work load. If you can live simple and put away a lump sum every year in retirement then you will do fine with their dividends for passive income if time is on your side.

title: A lot of opportunities
pros:
Selectors can make as much they want an hour 
Always willing to cross train for other warehouse jobs
Isn’t hard to get into management 
Great benefits and free lunch everyday
cons:
Hard to get any overtime 
Schedule is erratic crazy 
A lot of negative employees 
Some warehouse rules are dumb and don’t make sense sometime

title: Good place if you need experience, stay away if you don't.
pros: Good rotating schedule. Good dental insurance. Good place to gain experience in maintenance.
cons: 401k is capped at 500 per year. Only one health insurance plan is offered in Florida. You are treated as more of a "servant" to production workers. No training, if you are frequently left on your own to figure everything out.

title: Meh ok for first time job
pros: The other regular employees were great. Pay was decent
cons: Management was terrible. They put forth a family oriented place to work but if you have a death in your family or something major happens they only wanted to tell you how you were hurting your publix career because you needed a day off.

title: Great place to work
pros: Benefits, good pay, flexibility, high ladder to climb. Anyone with their head screwed on straight could conceivably advance as far as they'd like to.
cons: Full-time requires you to have an open schedule, since they'll likely be scheduling you for mostly random times. Produce shifts start as early as 4AM and finish around 11PM. Tough to build a life around this type of uncertainty

title: Bleed Green
pros: Great place to work if you plan to retire.
cons: Very political. You must fit a certain mold.

title: Not bad for students
pros:
Pay is deposited on a weekly basis for hourly employees. Many other places pay bi-weekly.

Medium-to-Large corporation with a regional footprint. Good for students who may seek to transfer stores during academic school year.
cons: Careers in retail side mostly require department management experience (including RIS/RARS). Distribution, Manufacturing, Facilities and Corporate offer more career options without without the retail management requirement.

title: Family
pros: Publix is a company that cares for their employees and customers. My coworkers are amazing and most patients are wonderful.
cons: The pharmacy department is becoming more quantity over quality, which makes it a less satisfying and more stressful job.

title: Publix is a goldmine for mentorship, equity
pros:
• earnest people-first culture
• generous associate appreciation
• manager approval not required to make something right for a customer
• potential for long-term stable employment
• flexible scheduling
• tuition reimbursement
• practical business school for the young and hungry
• lifelong friends and mentors
cons:
• pay is lower than most tipped service jobs
• customers are royalty, and can be cruel at times
• you'll work close to home and wear a nametag, privacy is hard to protect
• promote-from-within culture means it can take years to make an independent living while working there

title: Great Place to Work
pros:
- management is fair
- great place to make friends and meet people
- easy work, but fast paced
cons: - none at the moment

title: Review for Publix
pros: Good pay, movement within the company, great benefits
cons: Some bad apples in the company, lazy part timers , management is alright [ you have good days and bad days ]

title: It was fine
pros: Potential for growth and if the management at your store is good then it could be a good experience.
cons: Both the retail stores and the corporate side were very okay with sexual harassment and bosses who wanted nothing more than power and control. Not a great experience.

title: Stable Worker
pros: Great Environment, Pleasant Management, Great Hours, Good Benefits
cons: Sometimes mixed information about the job description, Cut back on hours

cons: The management was terrible. They would have hours that weren't consistent week-to-week. They hired me on and didn't inform me cleaning toilets and taking out trash would be a big part of the job. I wouldn't have taken it if I would have known.

title: It has its Ups and Downs

cons: Hours can be scarce during the summer. common things with every job like: some lazy coworkers,. Management will watch you with a close eye if you seem to be a distraction to others. Every store is different. Some people don't like their managers and some do. Moving up can be difficult at times. Some of the customers can be rude, but not all.

title: You most likely will not do any programming
pros:
-Salary is decent
-Benefits is decent
-Managers are usually nice
cons:
-As a programmer you will be dealing with the bureaucracy of implementing technology, you will NOT be programming
-Programmers do NOT program they simply work with vendors
-Technology is very outdated
-The computer you will use is very outdated
-Your computer is a desktop 
-The free lunch is free but the food is no bueno
-Health insurance is not the greatest
-Some weeks you will work a lot because something stops working and this happens a lot. For a lot of the systems that you will be the primary, your backup person will not be able to help you when something goes wrong because the backup will never get to work on this project. Their name will be on the project, but their hours will be on the project where they are primary
-People who have worked there for a long time are rude and just overall very negative about everything
-No onboarding and training
-A lot of programmers there just work there because it's pretty much one of the few places to work in Lakeland, not because they love it. And that shows!
-They ask you why it's so hard to hire and keep programmers, you tell them the honest truth and they don't implement any changes

title: Discrimination Flows Through the Heart of the Publix.
pros: Pay is better than competitors and the work conditions are cleaner and less hectic than other supermarkets.
cons:
Racist, sexist, and homophobic company. It’s only a matter of time before they find themselves in another mess due to their continued hate. Lawsuits already for discrimination against the black community and women. Need to be sued for discrimination by the homosexual community as well. Wouldn’t cover my script for PreP and as an out man, was not privy to the promotions given out to the married church goers. I had a manager once tell me to pray before meals if out with others for work. 

Hours in management are all over the place. As a Customer Service Manager, you get the short end of the stick because your department is the dumping grounds for lazy managers who don’t resolve issues with problem employees and your schedule is by far the least desirable amongst the other department managers. 

It’s a good ole boys club, if you don’t know sports, pretend to attend church, are female, another shade darker than white, homosexual, transgender, or any other minority, best of luck. The Publix culture one of exclusion.

title: Great place to work as a student
pros: Publix will work with you if you need to transfer stores like I did when I moved for college, and I was able to transfer back and forth when I came home for holidays or summer. The pay is okay and they are very flexible with your hours. Some good benefits if you stay a few years like free stock and 401k match.
cons: They say they promote from within but I have seen them bring in new people for higher positions. In fact I was next in line to move up to a customer service staff position when they brought in a new person my age as full time for that position. The worst part was I trained this person on how to run the cash register so it was somewhat of a degrading experience being as I’ve worked there for 6 years.

title: Not awful, but management is monkaS
pros: Good starting pay, good benefits for full time employees, easy to do your job well, good hours if you’re a good employee
cons: Annoying uniform (who the hell needs an apron that goes down to your knees to bag groceries), no tips allowed when you help customers to cars, management makes things 100x more stressful than it needs to be, no discount on groceries, culture is not for anyone who goes against the norm (if you’re not a cookie cutter straight edge suburban kid don’t work front service here)

title: Good place to work, with Favoritism culture very bad for people who is not the one like me.
pros:
manageable schedule. ok, pay for the first job.
a lot of young people in the front end, good for students.
cons:
too many hire new people, so people get only 5 hours per week, 9 hours per week, what people do with that?
less and less hour every week, I understand we need to share with others, that why I need to move on.

title: Deli is a great first job
pros: Publix pays part time employees well and hours are negotiable with Deli Manager and Assistant Deli Manager
cons: The kitchen is hard work. Closing shifts do more work combining the fact that they get all of rushes for sandwiches and hot food with the fact that cleaning the deli takes at minimum an hour. Each closing employee is given a task (cleaning sub bar, cleaning hot case, cleaning the meat slicing area. Publix is very much customer first so often your Store Manager or MIC will be getting on your department for something. More importantly, listen to your department specific manager as they usually know what’s best while the MIC is usually just damage controlling for the sake of the customer.

title: Publix Customer Service Associate
pros: Flexibility, Benefits, Training & Advancement
cons: None At This Time.

title: Interview Process at Publix
pros: Seemed like great company to further my career.  I have numerous years of retail management but was recently laid off
cons: I was called for an interview that lasted for 5 minutes and consisted of 4 questions.  The manager barely made eye contact. The following day he called to offer me a part time cashier position. I politely declined. When I began to explain he rudely interupted me and said " we all start at the bottom at Publix and that what I was worried about with you".  I started to ask for him to keep me in mind for Management positions, he hung up.  I hope this is not a true example of the management at Publix. I hope I get a call from another Manager

title: It can be extremely frustrating, but also rewarding.
pros: There's lots of good people working here, and if you get lucky and have a good management team, you can really feel fulfilled. The pay is ok, especially if you're just getting hired in and the benefits are great.
cons: The job can be thankless and you end up pulling more than your fair share of weight if you actually care. Your pay tends to stay just about even with people being hired in because they keep raising the minimum pay, but that doesn't bump every one else.

title: Not a bad first job
pros: Great working environment, co-workers are helpful and give you that extra guided edge to be successful
cons: Management is biased towards who they like and don't like, may take years to become full-time. Not a reliable job if you trying to get into management. They only choose a very small limited amount of people to get ahead and usually those people are the ones management likes which means they are the ones always up the managers butt, incessant talkers, the overly saturated drama queens and yes slackers as well

title: Great Company - Archaic Work Policies
pros: Friendly corporate culture, and lends some stability from a career learning.
cons: Weak compensation, and Stone Age alternative work arrangements

title: Disappointing
pros: Publix has great customer service because they hire great people, Shortly they come to realize that it’s different being on the inside then to Customer Service to receive from an outside point of view
cons: Unfortunately when it comes to management and how everything is run it is horrible every single manager in every department is stressed out through the roof, Hardwork is not rewarded or recognized  as it  it should be ,raises are not what they should be and far and few at that

title: Can be good
pros: If you are part time it’s a great place to work. Why you ask? Well it’s probably because they lay the entire success and/or failure on the full timers. They run the show!
cons: They will make you feel amazing. Tell you are in fact just that. Have meetings and parties and make you feel like you are family and they “care” then will just as easily let the people who worked their butts off to be promoted in record time. Come to work sick,hurting and just work them until they break.

title: Care more about corporate policies than employees... don't get sick
pros: Fellow associates are good and starting pay is reasonable
cons:
-Promotions are limited and take a long time to get (we are taking close to a year to become full time and many years to move any higher than that). 
- Publix has unusual and overly strict rule, especialy when it omes to what is considered an absesnce or tardy. If your sick you might as well consider your self repremended for an unexpcused absence.
- Very unorganzed when it comes to training as no two people seem to have the same way of doing things.

title: Alright, so..
pros:
If you have the right associates and managers around you, it’s an amazing place to work for!
You can really connect with some customers, and Writing on customers cakes for their special occasions is my personal favorite!
cons: Favoritism is big within management, associates like to talk about each other.. including management. Can’t really go to any managers about a problem because they don’t really care..

title: Publix is a great opportunity for many
pros: Great atmosphere. Management is great and always has your back incase of anything. You will be provided with great  benefits if you become fulltime. Becoming fulltime with the company introduces you to a lot more opportunities and possibilities.  Becoming a stockholder, moving in management, and having great 401k investment.
cons: Can be hard to keep yourself from showing any genuine emotions but happy and kind though the job definitely makes it easy when your treated with respect.

title: Good to place to work, good environment
pros: Opportunity to advance quickly, learn an abundance on operating a store, great benefits, employee owned stock which you can invest and also given to you for being an employee.
cons: Depending on your shift, position and location you are required to work some late nights.

title: Greed over employees
pros: I've been able to meet some really great people in my department who I can call friends.  Pay is decent I guess.
cons: The company doesn't care about it's employees like they LOVE to claim. Part timers aren't eligible for health insurance until a year in, or if you become full time. Becoming full time is nearly impossible if the managers decide they don't like you, even when you work your behind off every day. Period. Oh and let's hope you don't have to call out! Managers talk to employees about other employees. Drama, drama, drama.

title: Horrible hours !! They don't care !!
pros:
They allow you to request time off !! 
As any job would !!! And accepted when you have an emergency and can't make it , but must show excuse !!
cons:
They have a Moto, they take care of their employees they DONT ! THEY pick and choose to their liking !! If you miss work and have a legit excuse at HAND they retaliate with no HOURS !! YOU go from 30/35 to 12/15 which ain't even worth the DRIVE no matter how close or far you LIVE ! 

BETTER off working ELSEWHERE

title: Good Starter Job, But That's It...
pros: Flexibility if you are a part time worker. Job is easy, not much training necessary and decent starting pay. No experience generally required.
cons: Difficult to become full time, promotional opportunities are very limited unless you're willing to move. Very political once you start to move up. Horrible managers are either moved or promoted instead of fired. Publix tends to always take customers side and not afraid to humiliate employees in front of customers, even if they are following training.

title: It was okay
pros:
- Friendly co-workers (not so much managers)
- Customers like to chat with you
- Fast paced during the right hours
- You can make someone's day just by talking with them or taking out their groceries
cons:
- Did not feel like I was valued
- Was always scheduled for long shifts
- Would not work around my school hours
- Management were rude and childish, avoiding certain employees, talking behind each others' backs, and generally having an attitude of "I'm better than you"

title: Good pay, advancement based on performance reviews
pros: Great part time work, wish this was my first part time job as a teen I could've gotten so many raises and offered promotions because the work is simple and if you show that you are courteous to customers, can keep your work area clean, and show up on time or early then you will ace all your performance evals.
cons: Have heard through the grape vine that as you get up into managerial positions like store managers or district managers that it can be kind of like a "good ol boys" club.

title: Terrible. Part-timers get screwed while Managers over work anyone under them.
pros: It's sort of okay if you're 15. Co-workers are nice if they aren't management.
cons:
Pay isn't worth the workload.
Poor management.
Extreme favortism.
Very little to no room for growth.
Hard workers aren't given the appreciation they deserve.
Policy constantly changing at the cost of front-line worker while corporate lines their pockets.
Half of all management aren't adequately prepared for their positions.
Poor system in place for most departments. 
Poor protections in place for employees during the Covid-19 Pandemic.
Poor work/life balance.
Benefits sound enticing but they aren't worth it. Many other jobs offer the same benefits, higher pay, and a better work environment.
Overall I thoroughly hated my time spent working for this greedy corporation.

title: Good pay and perks, but uncomfortable work load
pros:
Competitive starting pay and room for advancement
Flexible schedule (for the most part). 
Benefits for workers
The store manager is almost always easily accessible (check with your store) and willing to answer questions
Paid training
Comfortable uniform
cons:
No employee discount 
Super strict rules for blocking and cleaning 
Department managers  can be impatient when training new hirees 
The hiring process takes several weeks and communication during that time was slow and inconsistent.
Can be difficult to get sufficient hours as a part-time employee
Department managers are rude if you call out when sick (even if it's legit)

title: A great place to work.
pros: Benefits are just OK. As full time I get sick/vacation pay, health/dental/vision. 401(k) with (a measly) company match, tuition reimbursement, everyone offers this stuff nowadays. The only thing that's unique is Profit sharing. ~8% of your annual pay comes back to you in privately owned company stock.
cons: Management is hit or miss, customers can be awful. The physical labor is not sustainable to retirement. My body or my mind will give out before I make it to retirement.

title: Loved the store level management, corporate - not so much
pros: The insurance is really good. They also give you stock for free after the completion of your second year and continue each year based on hours the previous year.
cons: They do not offer an employee discount which is lame. Corporate is constantly trying to add more tasks and duties without increasing the manpower to accommodate those tasks.

title: Hoping they treat employees the way the treat a human been
pros: Thayer don’t value your and work you to death and that part-time it’s than working two full-time job , I hope the change I did love for the company used to stand for. Food were treated  in a very safe way, I trust my stomach when it comes to food safety.
cons: I waited for almost 2 years for full-time , and try to get a transfer they refuse had to quit, call corporate about my manager they didn’t care less.

title: Bitter/ Aggressive management
pros: Coworkers ( non management )are kind
cons:
Low pay

Very obvious my current manager is not a fan of me. They are very aggressive in tone and I have been told by coworkers I am made fun of behind my back. I also had about 2 days of real training and am fairly new still , but am still expected to know things I was never trained on and am spoken to like I’m an idiot if I don’t. Rather than giving polite feedback they speaks in a condescending manner. Going to look for a different job where my potential is seen and I am valued unlike my current position.

title: Good company, awful managers
pros: pretty good pay and you get a bonus twice a year. Flexible with your schedule. The company values sound ideal
cons: Tons of drama. Publix is constantly promoting the wrong people who are terrible managers. On Saturdays and Sundays you probably won't get a beak and will end up working 10 hours straight and even after all that managers will complain that we dont have enough product on the floor even though you've been dying doing tons of work all day

title: great pay, work you like a dog
pros: pay, benefits, vacation, life insurance
cons: useless management, too many managers that don't work, promotes way too fast, higher ups like ris and regional corporate people have terrible attitudes and bully associates and managers. 7 years was all that I could do.

title: Don’t get roped into working here
pros: Benefits (401k, dental and eye insurance, stock), flexible schedule
cons: Dealing with extremely rude customers for very Low pay, unfair pay between departments and employees, strict with call outs and tardies, management constantly hovering over you, bad communication between management and employees and from corporate to stores, low and unfair raises during COVID 19 pandemic

title: Great company to work for
pros: Publix hires from within and never brings in managers from outside the company. Because of this it's easy for managers to relate to you, and help you become as successful as they have been.
cons: Corporate is constantly putting more pressure on managers. Especially the ones being promoted to stores North of Georgia like the Carolinas. I've see great people work hard after getting promoted only to leave and find themselves happier somewhere else.

title: Big Adult Pants
pros: Great pay (increasing pay as well). Management gets treated very well pay wise. Good hours. You could run a business after working here if you ever had to leave for some reason.
cons: Some store management doesn’t realize the full scale problem associates may have on department managers. Working the system, so to speak. In a hard store with problem associates.

title: A great place for a first job
pros:
Community
Hours
Schedule flexibility
Great for students with busy schedules
cons:
Some managers/team leaders were worse than others
Team conflict not handled well (when there were problems, depends on management)
Pay scale/raises—started at 8.25 and only made it up to 12.10 after 6 years of working there. Worked during the beginning of the pandemic as well, not enough compensation for the workers considering how hard they were working.

title: Good pay ,harsh schedule
pros: Good pay, promotes within, cares for customers
cons: schedule, close one night. Don’t get home till midnight or later to turn around and open the next day..Wong their at 530 am

title: Decent job with good pay
pros:
Very good benefits
Vacation hours
Normally kind management
A path to get promoted
cons:
Hours tend to be unreliable
(Depending on department) management will micromanage
Customer interactions are normally dealt with giving into almost unreasonable demands
Same path might take forever to get promoted or even set to full time

title: Great job for part-time, minor hiccups
pros: Pay is great, coworkers are awesome, fairly easy
cons: Managers get switched around a lot. I have found I liked the store managers way better than the assistant/CS managers, who can be fake or rude. They also started out paying a boy more than me (a girl). I had experience and the guy did not.

title: one of the worst companies i worked for in my life
pros: a job, some benefits but you wont get all that are listed unless 1 year of employment or worked 1.5k hours or are FT.
cons:
i have not been working there long but they LOVE TO PUNISH for the smallest of things, like saying to the managers that you cannot do a good job because of you receiving bad training, when your Manager scheduled you for training, it is very inconsistent for any On The Job training. the job is incredibly precise about everything and getting pulled aside for not being highly productive every time, unless you are full time, your hours are cut because of it.
the pay is good enough to get by but i have requesting more hours and training for weeks only to get lied too, but they will hire more people instead and now i go into work frustrated every day.
The Company says they have Open Door Policy and are there to help you, that is a BIG lie. i was hired to be Meals Clerk and that was shut down due to #COVID-19 and was cross trained into the deli department to be terribly trained, i have Commercial Kitchen through other companies i just don't know the publix way, the pay rate comparison is completely different, a Starting PT Meals Clerk makes the same as a PT Cashier $11.25/hr and a starting Deli clerk makes $12.30/hr. i received no Temp pay or any thing.
publix loves to bribe their employee's with free meal tickets MAYBE once a month.
the benefits list is complete bent LIE.
99% of those are guaranteed as a FT but as a PT employee you get Vision and Dental after 90 days, everything else you need to have worked 1.5k hours or work one Calendar Year of being hired.
i have worked for several grocery stores in my years, this is the worst one.

Management
punished for small things
Poor Training
the "great Place to work" is a LIE

title: Good job for short period of time
pros: Fulfilling at first, good starting pay.
cons: Open door policy is complete b.s. Complaints to management always fall through the cracks. Any lazy associates who fail to complete their work are not counseled on their inability to complete their work. Instead, the majority of their insufficient job performance falls onto the hard workers at publix.  Management is disorganized with no gameplan set in stone.

title: Good at ruining my mood everyday
pros:
-Good pay and benefits 
- that's really it
cons:
I don't even know where to begin. This was my first job and I had to quit after eight months. I've been thinking of coming back but have decided against it
- The management 
 When you're part time, all it really means is that they can schedule you up to 38 hours and give you an attitude if you stand up for yourself. I was in my first semester of college taking 6 classes and working that same amount. My manager wouldn't let me go down no matter how much I asked and even called me in on days where I had school. There were at least 3 times where I was really sick and she still made me close the entire department down by myself. The management all have a big ego for no reason. You guys are managers at a grocery store. You're not a doctor, lawyer, or anything significant. I understand it's your job and you need to be serious, but there's a way to be serious without being so insensitive. 
-The dress code 
Straight up discrimination. I'm a man and the main reason why I can't go back is because of the dress code. It's not fair that women can have long hair and earrings but I can't. I'm not trying to move up, so why do I have to follow these stupid rules. Personally, my hair and my earrings are very important to who I am. If you cut off a women's hair without her consent she wouldn't feel like herself. I can tie it up too, but that's not an option. I don't have tattoos all over my face and as a matter of fact I don't have any other piercings other than my ears. I take good care of my hair and I'm not cutting it off just to appeal to some old people. These rules needs to change because it's discrimination. 
-The customers
I don't know who these people think they are but they have no right to talk to me like they did. If I'm out of limes- I'm sorry. You don't need to yell at me. Don't even get me started on old people. They really think the world owes them something. 
-The work 
The work is easy but I always felt like I was micromanaged. I also hated staying til 2am just to do soda water backstocks. And even when I did them the managers didn't believe that I actually did it despite there being no more room for these things.

title: Okay place to work for

title: Yikes
pros: The views of the ocean
cons:
Everything you can possibly imagine, and more. 
Step back a few decades and picture yourself in a work environment where rampant racism and sexual harassment are all apart of a days work. If you're having a hard time picturing that a few decades ago, that's quite alright, just apply for a job at the Ocean House. You can experience it first hand! They will manipulate your hours too. Make sure to keep track of your own hours because they will find ways to change them. They use an outdated excel spreadsheet to calculate your tips on a weighed points system that is based on favorites. oh what fun!

title: Lacking customer focus and suffers from organizational dysfunction
pros: State employees are given generous vacation and sick time. Low stress, very good work-life balance.
cons:
Projects move at an alarmingly slow pace and very frequently without any meaningful leadership direction. IT leadership micromanages employees and does not value forward thinking or progress driven staff. Empowering users that work, teach, research and learn within the organization is not a priority. 

Organizational goals are often blue-sky ideas without measurable or obtainable results.

Specifically, IT leadership prohibits users from doing their tasks either directly or indirectly often dismissing them as troublesome departments who won't understand technology. However, a large sum of money is spent on consultants to steer the company in a better direction but with no noticeable results. Many times the consultants come to the same conclusion as the employees years earlier. 

Pay is not commensurate with experience nor competitive within the area.

title: It all depends on your team
pros:
If you are lucky enough to be in a great team, you will have a fine opportunity to grow as an engineer towards seniority and tech leadership. You can be trusted by your coworkers to make the right calls and they know you will do your best to deliver. 

There are people who work really hard to keep everything technical and everyday things in the office running smoothly. They are happy to help you with any problem you might be facing and they can really make Zopa a great place to work, not the senior management or HR. It's your team and your fellow engineers that matters.

As a fintech, it's surprisingly relaxed but obviously being a regulated industry, there is some mandatory bureaucracy involved. 

If you're a talented junior to mid-level engineer, go for it. It's a great chance to grow.
cons:
All the major decision making happens somewhere outside of your reach. It certainly feels that they are sometimes making the wrong decisions and there's nothing you can do about it. Communication across the company is bad, sometimes almost nonexistent. 

Although the tech teams are great and full of talented people, they are very shorthanded and there's simply too much on their table.

The company is big enough not to have a strong company wide culture. You don't really get to know people who work in a totally different department of the company.

title: It had so much promise.
pros:
Cool office, location, people. Zopa used to be such a vibrant, friendly, challenging and exciting place to work. 

Friday beers, games, weekly town hall events, etc were all cool. 

HR were great at Zopa, and did a fantastic job.

Modern, cutting edge tech, although it was often executed poorly, it sometimes made for a fulfilling role.
cons:
There were times where our technical advice was completely ignored by senior management. 

The CTO acted like a tech lead, which caused a lot of friction, and led to a lot of expensive decisions being made without adequate thought or planning.

There were other times where I was under a savage amount of pressure to keep the ship afloat, while my team disappeared around me in a very short space of time.

Bullying, agro, weak management, in-fighting, awful hiring practices and throwing good money after bad, ultimately led or in my opinion, will lead, to Zopa failing as a business. 

One of our senior managers got tickets to a Major Tennis tournament from one of our vendors, two weeks later, we were building two new physical data centers, despite having a full cloud platform. 

The salary was well below the industry standard, pay and performance reviews weren't taken seriously. When I left I literally doubled my base salary.

I honestly feel that Zopa has spent years of effort, and a fortune of money, where in reality it has done more to develop a banking culture than a Bank.

If planning on joining Zopa please rethink your choice, if you like to gossip and not get the job done then this is the place for you.

title: Wonderful coworkers, changing management
pros:
(1) Best people I've had the pleasure to work with
(2) Most of the Direct Managers have a lot of hands-on experience and are great mentors
(3) Compensation was competitive for not being in or around Boston (excellent commute from Southern Worcester County)
cons:
(1) The new management at the C-Level is no longer homegrown and they bring a corporate culture to a place that once proved that a company can thrive without it
(2) Consecutive annual layoffs since January 2019 with victims chosen from the top down and no I put from direct managers, and no attempt to redistribute the affected resources
(3) Not much North America / EMEA / Latin America revenue growth for most product offerings, most revenue figures are propped up by Asia-PAC
(4) Even in the 3 year span I was there, there was a major culture shift that has since helped me realize that getting laid off was a veiled blessing
(5) In retrospect, there was very little room for upward mobility in 3 years

title: Waters creates business advantages for laboratory-dependent organizations by delivering scientific innovation.
pros: Waters is completely focused on improving human health and well-being through the application of high-value analytical technologies and industry-leading scientific expertise. All this is done in order to deliver the benefit to its customers, partners, and shareholders.
cons: Waters is hesitant to expand its business into other areas.

title: Do not join, employees are leaving Waters like a sinking ship!!!
pros: Not working for Waters and some colleagues
cons: The company has managed to confirm how it operates in a time of a global emergency. The senior leadership team & certain VPs (product management). No strategy & vision in Waters. Toxic management & leadership. Redundancy, furlough and job losses. A business like Waters should not be furloughing especially selling into the Pharmaceutical industry. Nobody questions anything, if you do you are seen as a trouble maker. Decisions are made by someone shouting the loudest and nothing is validated. Asking customers that they know and love is the way forwards. Waters thinks that the products are the best. Solutions and products are so narrow and niche and very very fixated. No flexibility or options. No validation with the customers and the markets. Sometimes, competitors do get it right, and learn from them. Waters is a company that continues to make mistakes over and over again. None of the senior leadership team learn from their mistakes. This has proved to be an eye opener for employees in Waters. All Waters will do is take it out on the employees. No self-reflection what so ever. Be aware of toxic managers in product management and marketing departments. These people have risen through the ranks and will only look out for themselves.... New employees are coming in and not staying longer than 12 months... No training or investment (other than if you are the favorite). Honestly, join Sciex, Agilent or even Thermo.... The companies are all still matrix, but the products and solutions actually meet customer expectations... The processes are so cumbersome it actually prevents people from moving forwards. The company is being driven by cowards who unfortunately, are there to stay. Diversity in the company is a joke. Not once have I seen an ethnic employee promoted or even properly recruited... It's a Caucasian driven company where 'white people' rule.... Waters is so out of touch with their employees and customers it's untrue. Check job descriptions.... The company will lie, recruit you and the job will be nothing like the job spec. HR are absolutely useless.... They will support the cowardly managers at every turn. Don't leave your job to join Waters, it is a decision you will regret. It's a product and career graveyard... So many employees have left... So many vacancies not because of organic growth. Check with previous and existing employees.... You are better off being unemployed for a while and look for a job with more meaning and worth. The company motto 'deliver benefit' yes, only to the senior leadership team. Not to the employees and the customers.... the individuals that really matter.

title: Dark Waters Ahead
pros: No expense spared for internal manufacturing. Top of the line equipment. Low pressure to perform. Formal education is not a barrier for higher level roles.
cons:
Waters is doing it's best to narrate a future MBA student cautionary tale case-study in CEO transition failures. 

It developed a toxic culture over the recent years pitting internal groups against each other, with a CEO who seems to enjoy the title and the benefits, but is no Doug Berthiaume replacement. Add in a hobbled R&D group that can't seem to keep good talent for long, you get a company facing some serious and otherwise avoidable headwinds.

title: Sinking ship really do not join
pros: Nothing absolutely nothing, very toxic bad leadership
cons: Boris/Trump style leadership. No accountability. Bad decisions made only to get rewarded with a senior position & better pay. Not the reliable, stable company it once was. Products mean nothing as the customers & employees. Management will blame everything going on in the world except themselves! Revenue very very poor. Good attrition - it’s a case of the blind leading the blind. Not the market leader despite what they say at interviews.... so many job cuts & losses - because of BAD leadership! Toxic & back stabbing management. Everyone one for themselves. Management never do what they promise. Career progression & training only for a select few.

title: The right fit for the right people
pros: If you can manage your time wisely, this is definitely the job for you.  You set your own schedule, and as long as you meet the needs of the customers, you are pretty well set.  Very good benefits and a very laid back place to work.
cons: There is a lot of travel, especially at the beginning of your career as an FSS.  This is because of all of the training and certifications you must obtain in order to perform the job.

title: Great people & work environment, but stuck in the past.
pros: Relaxed work environment for the most part. If you are a high performer, you will be recognized, and allowed to work on projects that most interest you. Good culture and general positive attitude.
cons: Pay is mediocre even with high performance. Very corporate structure (upward mobility is based on years experience and "politics"). Systems & processes are very outdated and there is a resistance to change with an aging workforce. Lack of "new-age" benefits like unlimited PTO, flexible hours, and working from home.

title: Save your health and sanity
pros: Some colleagues are nice and supportive
cons: Company going down fast. Poor leadership, lack of direction & management overload. Company hires people only to have them not do the job. Bullying & toxic behaviour is very common. No one will help or do anything about it. Products have no benefits or value. Managers are looking at the market with rose tinted glasses. Managers sit in ivory towers counting their bonus! Favouritism is the name of the game. Lack of clarity, no clear instructions. Inexperienced managers promoted because they make lots of noise. Do yourself a favour & don’t think of joining this company. Better of taking a lower paid job & work for the competitor. Shockingly bad culture & company.

title: Slipping Behind Peers
pros: The CEO is very likable and approachable. The town halls offer an opportunity for all level of workers to understand the direction of the company.  With an international footprint, it has a nice multi-cultural environment. Engineers are very talented. Logistics improving and strategy in Asia is paying off. Well respected in the Industry with a long line of legacy products. Manufacturing teams are some of the best in the industry, from the machine-tool workers in Milford, to the good folks in Taunton. Informatics software is the Gold Standard in labs.
cons: Most managers don't have a managerial background, so there is a wide range of competent and incompetent managers. Some departments are vastly overstaffed, refusing change management, or embracing digital transformation. Digital Marketing and eCommerce woefully behind peers, wasteful of investments and led by managers without experience or vision. For a billion-dollar company, HR is mostly missing except to handle lay-offs or to onboard new employees. Waters is like the IBM of yesterday. "No one ever got fired for buying IBM" was the saying for managers that bought IBM computers. This was true. However, IBM leaned too heavy on their service contracts and stopped innovating (Watson withholding). Waters is like the IBM of old, once know for patents and innovation. Waters exists because of the many Apps Notes utilizing their legacy chemistry, etc. Like IBM, I see a rocky road ahead for Waters; even with the very capable CEO they have.
